result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Laquan Dumas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License (3rd+ w/in 3yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 1:30 PM Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anthony L. Dumas appeared by video, in custody at the Rock County Jail.  Attorney C. James Fitzgerald appeared by video for Anthony L. Dumas. Defendant waives right to appear in person in courtroom. Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1; Court finds defendant guilty.  Defendant pleads guilty to Count 2; Court finds defendant guilty. Defendant waives right to pre sentence investigation. Court orders on Count 1 - 30 days Rock County Jail concurrent with Count 2; Count 2 - 1 year Wisconsin State Prison and 3 years Extended Supervision, concurrent with 21CF1192, 22CF277 and any sentence currently being served, any treatment deemed necessary, absolute sobriety, no alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, DOC collect costs on both Counts, 127 days sentence credit. Defendant is eligible for Challenge and Substance Abuse Programs.

10:04 AM Defendant Anthony Laquan Dumas in court, in person in custody at the Rock County Jail with attorney C. James Fitzgerald in person.  Cheniqua White appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Bailey sworn in and testified in person. Witness identified Defendant. State moves for bind over, Defense objects with argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and matter continued to follow 22CF277. Defense requests bond modification, State objects with argument. Court grants modification with conditions: No driving without a valid license or insurance. No contact directly or indirectly with victim A.W., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No in person contact with Z.H.
